block.p: I'm becoming concerned with the way Americans deal with obesity (''Watching Volunteers: Experts Seek Clues to Eating Disorders''). It seems that if obesity were a true genetic disorder, we would see it in other countries to a similar degree, and we do not. Americans simply eat too much and exercise too little. The medicalization of obesity is reminiscent of the very American trait of not taking responsibility for one's behavior.
